title: Global-E Shares 25% Higher After 4Q Revenue Beat, Guidance

contentObject.content: Global-E Online Ltd. shares rose 25% to $46.25 after the cross-border e-commerce enablement company's quarterly results and guidance exceeded analyst expectations.
Global-E Online after the bell Wednesday reported fourth quarter revenue rose 54% to $82.7 million, beating the FactSet consensus for $77.6 million.
Per-share loss was 15 cents, compared to the FactSet consensus for a loss of 16 cents.

The company guided for first quarter revenue of $74.5 million to $76.5 million and 2022 revenue of $411 million to $421 million. FactSet consensus had been for first quarter revenue of $64 million and fiscal year revenue of $367 million.
Raymond James said results broadly exceeded its expectations, including a 2022 outlook that topped consensus.

"While most of this relates to the Flow acquisition that wasn't included in street numbers, the organic growth outlook is still north of 50% per our math, and would be one of the fastest growing software assets," Raymond James said in a note.
Global-e in January closed its acquisition of Flow Commerce Inc., a cross-border e-commerce software solution for emerging brands.

"We're also encouraged that recent partnership efforts (particularly Shopify) and international expansion efforts are on track, setting the table for new merchant growth in 2023 and beyond," Raymond James said.
Write to Michael Dabaie at michael.dabaie@wsj.com
